result.execSummary:
The defendant Bethany L. Bridell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:35 PM Cases called: 22CF428, 22CF443 & 22CF468. Defendant Bethany L. Bridell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court for Bethany L. Bridell.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis  in court for State of Wisconsin. Dr. Craig Schoenecker appeared via Zoom video. The parties are in agreement regarding competency and the doctor's testimony is not needed for today's purposes. Dr. Schoenecker. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in all cases and counts. Court accepts waiver and binds the matters over for further proceedings. Information in all files will mirror the criminal complaints.

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1 in 22CF428: Threat to Law Enforcement Officer and Count 3 in 22CF468: Criminal Damage to Property. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders on 22CF428: 2 years Probation sentence withheld with conditions 
Conditions of Probation:
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
No contact with Officer Ryan Prock or Officer Noah Young unless in their official capacity; or if agent and officers approve.
Defendant not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
court costs and surcharges

Court orders on 22CF468: 1 year Probation sentence withheld with conditions, concurrent to 22CF428.
Conditions of Probation:
No contact with M.E., T.W. or T.Z.
No contact with residence at 428 N. Barstow Street in Eau Claire
Restitution to M.E. in the amount of $4,791.87 plus 10% surcharge
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
court cost and surcharges. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in, including all of 22CF443.
152 days of jail credit if revoked Probation in both cases.
Competency hearing on September 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

*CONFIDENTIAL*
by Dr. Craig Schoenecker, dated 09/02/2022

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
3:36 PM Cases called: 22CF428, 22CF443 & 22CF468. Defendant Bethany L. Bridell in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Bethany L. Bridell.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Dr. Christina Engen appeared via Zoom video.  Parties are in receipt of Dr. Christina Engen's report. Dr. Engen's report finds the Defendant not competent to proceed. Defendant  believes that she is competent. 

State calls Dr. Christina Engen to testify. She is sworn and testifies. Cross examination by Defense. Witness is excused.

Arguments by counsel. 
Court finds that the Defendant is not competent to proceed at this time, but will likely regain competence. 

Court orders the proceedings suspended and commits the Defendant to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months.
The defendant is granted 47 days of credit  for pre-commitment incarceration. 
Court does not order the involuntary administration of medication as the doctor was unable to testify as to this topic.
Competency hearing on June 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

(Cases 22CF428, 22CF443, 22CF468 are called at 8:38 AM) Defendant Bethany L. Bridell in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Thorson in court for Bethany L. Bridell.  Attorney Afton Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant wishes to contest the findings in the Dr.'s report- indicating she is competent. State requests new date for testimony by Dr. Engen. 
Competency Hearing: 6/07/2022 at 4:00 PM (set for 1/2 hour- Zoom for Dr.). State will confirm the date with Dr. Engen.

*CONFIDENTIAL*
by Dr. Christina Engen, dated 05/25/2022
Competency hearing on May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order approving request by Dr. Christina Engen for competency report extension.
Dated 05/10/2022, letter from Dr. Christina Engen to Court requesting an extension to file competency report.

Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on May 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:21 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bethany L. Bridell appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Karl Schmidt. 
Waives reading of the complaint. State asks court to find probable cause and asks Court to order a competency evaluation. 
Court finds probable cause the defendant committed a felony based on information in the criminal complaint and orders a competency evaluation. 
A competency hearing is scheduled (with other files) on 5/16/22 at 3:30 PM.

ADDRESS INFO for Bethany L. Bridell
Current: 6507 Chowen Ave N, Minneapolis, MN 55429 United States  (Effective: 04-25-2022)
Prior: 428 N Barstow St #3, Eau Claire, WI 54703

Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, New address per USPS
Re-sent to new address 04/25/2022

(11:05 AM case called.) Prosecuting Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bethany L. Bridell does not appear in court, is in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Bethany L. Bridell. 
Both State and Attorney Linzmeier raise competency and request to address.
State requests $1,000.00 cash bond. Attorney Linzmeier objects to no contact conditions.
Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions.
Initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Conditions:
No contact with M.E., T.W., T.Z., N.C.& with Apartment Building at 428 N. Barstow St Eau Claire.
No contact with E.B. Rentals at 927 Loring St in Eau Claire.
